title: Pauline Hanson Suspended From Senate For One Week After Burqa Stunt | 10 News
description: One Nation leader Pauline Hanson is standing by her move to wear a burqa in federal parliament despite being condemned from all sides of politics.  The Senator has also been banned from the Senate for a week. title: Melbourne Father Found Dead With One Gunshot Wound In Mystery Shooting | 10 News
description: Mystery surrounds the shooting death of a man in Altona North in the early hours of this morning. The father of one was found with a single gunshot wound in what investigators are calling a non-suspicious fatality, but sources suggest it may not be that simple, with significant criminal links involved. title: Convicted Child Killer, Bevan Spencer Von Einem Nears Death | 10 News
description: There's little hope that convicted murderer and suspected serial killer Bevan Spencer Von Einem will shed light on any crimes before he dies. The man whose actions terrified a state is terminally ill, in a prison infirmary, but it's believed he's too ill to talk to detectives, even if he wanted to. title: Pope Leo XIV Gifts Apartment To Homeless Pregnant Mother & Child In Sydney | 10 News
description: A Sydney mum who was homeless and heavily pregnant has been gifted an apartment by the Pope. In an extraordinary act of kindness, Nadia Howlader and her beautiful little girl, Alisha, now have a place to call their own through the St Vincent de Paul Society, which helped her travel to Rome to thank the Pontiff in person. title: England Bamboozled By Travis Head's Match-Winning Ashes Knock | 10 News
description: England quick Mark Wood says he never expected Travis Head to open for Australia in the second innings of the First Ashes Test, describing the Aussie's match-winning knock as "something else". Despite the painful drubbing in Perth, Wood insists the visitors are determined to focus on what's ahead. title: Queensland Teachers Strike For Better Pay & Working Conditions | 10 News
description: Tens of thousands of Queensland teachers have walked off the job, venting their frustrations over workplace violence. The Education Minister claims the union keeps moving the goal posts in pay negotiations as the threat of another strike looms large. title: Top Nazi Politician's Grandson Speaks Out | 10 News+
description: German pastor Henrik Lenkeit was shocked to discover his grandfather was top Nazi politician Heinrich Himmler through a World War II documentary.  Himmler, Hitler’s deputy and a main architect of the Holocaust, was involved in an affair with Lenkeit’s grandmother that led to two children, one of whom was Lenkeit’s mother. title: Church Pastor Discovers Grandfather Was Top Nazi Heinrich Himmler | 10 News+
description: German pastor Henrik Lenkeit was shocked to discover his grandfather was top Nazi politician Heinrich Himmler through a World War II documentary. Himmler, Hitler’s deputy and a main architect of the Holocaust, was involved in an affair with Lenkeit’s grandmother that led to two children, one of whom was Lenkeit’s mother. He told 10 News+ the discovery was psychologically devastating, and he now speaks out against antisemitism, decrying everything his grandfather stood for. title: Pauline Hanson Shares Steak Dinner With Barnaby Joyce | 10 News+
description: One Nation leader Pauline Hanson has cooked a steak dinner on a sandwich press in her Canberra office for Nationals MP Barnaby Joyce. It comes a day after Hanson was suspended from the Senate for seven days over wearing a burqa as a political stunt. She remains defiant, saying she decided to don the religious garment worn by some Muslim women after the Senate blocked a debate on her bill to ban it. title: Ukrainian Army Medic Shares Frontline Video Showing Rescue Mission | 10 News+
description: Ukraine has significantly amended Donald Trump’s peace plan, removing some points that cater to Russia’s demands. 10 News+ has spoken to a Ukrainian combat medic, who has shared video footage of an evacuation mission from the frontline, showing his battalion rescuing a badly injured soldier struck by Russian drones. title: Top Nazi's Grandson Speaks Out, Housing Price Projections, Video From Ukraine's Frontline | 10 News+
description: German pastor Henrik Lenkeit was shocked to discover his grandfather was top Nazi politician Heinrich Himmler through a World War II documentary. Himmler, Hitler’s deputy and a main architect of the Holocaust, was involved in an affair with Lenkeit’s grandmother that led to two children, one of whom was Lenkeit’s mother. He told 10 News+ the discovery was psychologically devastating, and he now speaks out against antisemitism, decrying everything his grandfather stood for.  One Nation leader Pauline Hanson has cooked a steak dinner on a sandwich press in her Canberra office for Nationals MP Barnaby Joyce. It comes a day after Hanson was suspended from the Senate for seven days over wearing a burqa as a political stunt. She remains defiant, saying she decided to don the religious garment worn by some Muslim women after the Senate blocked a debate on her bill to ban it.  Ukraine has significantly amended Donald Trump’s peace plan, removing some points that cater to Russia’s demands. 10 News+ has spoken to a Ukrainian combat medic, who has shared video footage of an evacuation mission from the frontline, showing his battalion rescuing a badly injured soldier struck by Russian drones.  A new report on Australia’s house prices shows that they are set to continue rising, in every capital city, under every possible scenario. Under the best case scenario, Perth would see the most price growth, up to 14%, while Adelaide and Brisbane are at a 12% projection. The report’s author Louis Christopher says the newly extended 5% First Home Buyers Deposit Scheme is to partly to blame, as well as this year’s rate cuts incentivising investors to buy in the market. title: Severe Storms Rip Through Australia’s East Coast & Queensland Faces Cleanup and Insurance Catastroph
description: Australia’s east coast is once again being hit by severe storms that tore through late this afternoon. The line of storms stretched from Longreach in Queensland to the Hunter region of New South Wales.  This latest round of storms is also impacting Queensland, where cleanup continues tonight after much of the southeast was battered by giant hail yesterday. An insurance catastrophe has been declared in the hardest-hit areas. title: Man Posing as Woman for Three Years Collects $90,000 Before Police Uncover True Identity | 10 News
description: Italian authorities have revealed a woman who has been collecting pension benefits for three years isn't quite who she appeared to be.   More than 90 thousand dollars in cheques were handed over, before Italian police discovered it was in fact a dude who looked like a lady. title: Storms Batter Australia’s East Coast, Melbourne Stabbing Arrest Sparks New Details | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – Australia’s east coast is once again being hit by severe storms that tore through this afternoon. The line of storms stretched from Longreach in Queensland to the Hunter region in New South Wales. Queensland is still dealing with the cleanup from this latest round of severe weather. title: Projections Show House Prices Set To Rise In Every Australian Capital | 10 News+
description: A new report on Australia’s house prices shows that they are set to continue rising, in every capital city, under every possible scenario. Under the best case scenario, Perth would see the most price growth, up to 14%, while Adelaide and Brisbane are at a 12% projection. The report’s author Louis Christopher says the newly extended 5% First Home Buyers Deposit Scheme is to partly to blame, as well as this year’s rate cuts incentivising investors to buy in the market.
